description._content: TITLE Old Jail in Keene NH CREATOR SUBJECT Buildings - NH - Keene Jails - NH - Keene DESCRIPTION Photograph of the old jail in Keene New Hampshire, located on the corner of Washington and Mechanic streets. The stone building was built 1833 "using 1400 tons of Roxbury granite and four tons of iron in the construction of one of the strongest and most thoroughly built prisons in the Union. It contained 4 cells on the first floor and 3 above, and...measured 24 x 36 feet. A jailer's house constructed of brick was erected next to the new jail." It was used until 1884, when the new Cheshire County Jail was built. PUBLISHER Keene Public Library DATE DIGITAL 20071015 DATE ORIGINAL pre 1884 RESOURCE TYPE photographs FORMAT image/jpg RESOURCE IDENTIFIER hsykbdg021 RIGHTS MANAGMENT No known restriction on publication.
